dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool uses ArcHydroTools to generate the following rasters: str, str900, cat, and lnk. Feature classes of drainageLine, catchment, adjointCatchment, and drainagePoint are also created. This tool only runs using Python 2 as ArcHydro tools are not fully implemented with Python 3.

tool.name: posthydrodem

param.name: workspace
param.dialogReference: File geodatabase for feature classes and grids.

param.name: facPth
param.dialogReference: Path to flow accumulation grid generated by hydrodem.

param.name: fdrPth
param.dialogReference: Path to flow direction grid generated by hydrodem.

param.name: thresh1
param.dialogReference: Threshold used to create the stream grid, usually equal the number of cells with an area of 45,000,000 m^2. This area threshold is equivalent to 50,000 30x30 cells. Refer to the StreamStats Data Preparation Workflow documentation for thresholds for other grid resolutions.

param.name: thresh2
param.dialogReference: Threshold used to create the str900 grid, usually equal to the number of cells with an area of 90,000 m^2. This area threshold is equivalent to 900 30x30 m cells. Refer to the StreamStats Data Preparation Workflow documentation for thresholds for other grid resolutions.

param.name: sinksPth
param.dialogReference: Path to a previously created sinklink grid.

tool.summary:
This tool uses ArcHydroTools to generate the following rasters: str, str900, cat, and lnk. Feature classes of drainageLine, catchment, adjointCatchment, and drainagePoint are also created. This tool only runs using Python 2 as ArcHydro tools are not fully implemented with Python 3.

Complete documentation can be found at XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX.
tool.usage: Run via the Python 2 executable supplied by ArcMap.
